page.title: 13Jersey Royal Potato 2.
page.content: In recent years both dead and live beetles have been found on the beaches but have not attacked the crops. The potato season is from late May until early July. The farmers take their crops to one of the l2 packing stations where they are graded into Mids and Wares and then weighed and put into 25 kilogram sacks. The bags are stitched and put onto one ton pallets, which are sent to the harbour for export. Only so many tons of potatoes can be handled by the English market each day without the price dropping so, when this tonnage is reached, a stop-digging order is imposed to maintain the price. The industry is very important to Jersey. Last year ll-l2 million pounds worth of potatoes were exported. The Le Maistre station in Trinity packs up to 800 tons per week, all for export.
